@ianhanomansing I never recline. I‚Äôd select a seat that doesn‚Äôt recline if it saved me a few dollars. Would the airline then charge a little more for the seat behind it?

The seats at the back of the plane usually don‚Äôt recline? I never want to be very last person off, though.

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can‚Äôt switch. I don‚Äôt remember much of anything from my childhood (it‚Äôs the reason I don‚Äôt feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don‚Äôt know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.
subs.rawText: @AnakanaSchofiel Ambidextrous implies equally good at both sides. I can‚Äôt switch. I don‚Äôt remember much of anything from my childhood (it‚Äôs the reason I don‚Äôt feel a lot of nostalgia in general, whatever), so I don‚Äôt know why I write with my left hand but use scissors in my right hand.

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don‚Äôt tell anybody this, I‚Äôm right-handed doing everything that isn‚Äôt writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay
subs.rawText: @AnakanaSchofiel Yes, except, and don‚Äôt tell anybody this, I‚Äôm right-handed doing everything that isn‚Äôt writing. I still get to claim Barack Obama as one of my own. #LeftHandersDay

subs.text: @AnakanaSchofiel Being left-handed gets in the way sometimes, because it‚Äôs a right-handed world. That said, every time one of us sees another person writing left-handed, we make eye contact, and have an instant rapport. #LeftHandersDay

I would‚Äôve been a handsome hero today if I had happened to have hand lotion on me, but I didn‚Äôt, so I wasn‚Äôt. What I‚Äôm trying to tell you is that I just bought hand lotion.

subs.text: My handsome heroism today was limited to offering to take a group‚Äôs photo. Any time I see someone breaking off from a group to take a photo (or what looks like is going to be a bad group selfie [Hint: almost all group selfies are bad]), I wordlessly offer to take it for them.

subs.text: I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It‚Äôs one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal [link]
subs.rawText: I enjoyed this podcast from @TalkingDrupal about the Book Module. It‚Äôs one of my favourite modules, and I use it extensively on my Drupal 7 site. It should probably be called the Outline module, since you can then use Drupal as a content outliner. #drupal https://t.co/Iklbp4tWeG

subs.text: Turning content into a ‚Äúbook‚Äù may have been the module‚Äôs original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.
subs.rawText: Turning content into a ‚Äúbook‚Äù may have been the module‚Äôs original function, but the outline part of it service a more general purpose.

subs.text: They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there‚Äôs no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).
subs.rawText: They talk about an outline not being able to have more than one parent, but I do recall it being possible by adding a reference in the database, even if there‚Äôs no UI for it (maybe not in the post-Drupal 8 incarnation of the software, but definitely in a previous version).

subs.text: August 3
@rtanglao I procrastinate about everything else, but the prospect of Singaporean-Malaysian food in Toronto, and close by, no less, had me leaping out of my seat!
subs.rawText: @rtanglao I procrastinate about everything else, but the prospect of Singaporean-Malaysian food in Toronto, and close by, no less, had me leaping out of my seat!

subs.text: @rtanglao I went to Stackt Market, where their website said they were, on February 6th, and it was nowhere to be found. I assume the January COVID restrictions did them in.
subs.rawText: @rtanglao I went to Stackt Market, where their website said they were, on February 6th, and it was nowhere to be found. I assume the January COVID restrictions did them in.

subs.text: @rtanglao Update: By the time I got there, it was gone.

subs.text: Do you feel like all of the possible opinions about something have been expressed by the time you get to a news item?

subs.text: We‚Äôre living in an era where somebody else has already been the first to express their feelings about something, and all you can do is press the üëçüèª or ‚ù§Ô∏è button on it.

subs.text: The Amber Alert system can, and should, be improved.
subs.rawText: The Amber Alert system can, and should, be improved.

subs.text: For instance, when linking to a website in an Amber Alert, the website should be able to withstand a large and sudden traffic spike.
subs.rawText: For instance, when linking to a website in an Amber Alert, the website should be able to withstand a large and sudden traffic spike.

subs.text: When the website does work, it shouldn‚Äôt show that there are no active alerts when there is an active alert. [link]
